content: The senior enlist of each service get extra/position pay. The Chief of Staff/Commandant of the services also receives extra/position. If they leave that position they forfeit extra pay. Most people do not realize that position trumps grade. The coast guard runs in to that with their enlisted command positions more than the others services. God and the soldier, All men adore, In time of trouble, And no more; For when war is over, And all things righted, God is neglected - The old soldier slighted. Founding Member Original DVG & Proud Member, Rupterd Duck/Derelict Veterans

content: Oh so true, Bruce! For example, my leave requests and other personnel actions (excluding OER) have to go through my Company Commander ... a very junior Army Captain, even though I'm a Lieutenant Colonel. This is often the case in Army Medical Department (AMEDD) units, where one's chain of command has a fork: one for clinical aspects (more traditionally tied to rank + position), the other for TDA purposes (rank generally irrelevant).

content: quote: Originally posted by 7thGrpSig: I was always curious about something... Is the SGT Major of The Army a higher rank than E-9? Is there an E-10? Nope, but the highest enlisted (pay) grades are designated by an S for Special. Such as E-9S. That goes for all five branches. That's the highest enlisted you can go. No one starts a war--or rather, no one in his senses ought to do so--without first being clear in his mind what he intends to achieve by that war and how he intends to conduct it. Carl von Clausewitz
